Ingredients.4: 1 (15 ounce) can chili beans in spicy sauce

Ingredients.5: 2 (28 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with juice

Ingredients.9: 1  green bell pepper, seeded and chopped

Ingredients.10: 1  red bell pepper, seeded and chopped

Ingredients.11: 2  green chile peppers, seeded and chopped

Ingredients.15: 0.25 cup chili powder, or more to taste

Ingredients.20: 2 teaspoons hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)

Ingredients.25: 1 teaspoon salt, or more to taste

Ingredients.26: 1 teaspoon ground black pepper, or more to taste

Ingredients.27: 1 (10.5 ounce) bag corn chips (such as Fritos®)

Directions.1: Heat a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Crumble ground chuck and sausage into the hot pan. Cook, stirring frequently, until meat is evenly browned. Drain off excess grease.

Directions.2: Pour in chili beans, spicy chili beans, diced tomatoes, and tomato paste. Add celery, onion, bell peppers, chile peppers, bacon bits, bouillon, beer, 1/4 cup chili powder, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, oregano, cumin, hot pepper sauce, basil, cayenne, paprika, sugar, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon black pepper. Stir to blend, then cover and simmer over low heat for at least 2 hours, stirring occasionally.

Directions.3: Taste and season with more salt, pepper, and chili powder if necessary. The longer the chili simmers, the better it will taste. Remove from the heat and serve, or cool, refrigerate, and reheat the next day.

Directions.4: To serve, ladle hot chili into bowls and top with corn chips and Cheddar cheese.
